The Pulse gesture scales using Presence and produces an emanation with 10 foot radius, dealing 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. The gesture requires 2 Hands to cast and has a base cost of 5 Action and 2 Focus.

Playtest Notes

This talent is currently placed at a Tier 4 node. It will eventually only be attainable at a higher level (probably Level 6 required). It is currently available "early" for testing.

Arcana Novice.name: Arcana Novice
Arcana Novice.description:
Your education covered the fundamentals of metaphysics and magical theory, the relationship between the runes, the opposing nature of order and chaos, and a cursory introduction to spiritual beings including the most commonly known deified and demonized figures of worship. You gain the Novice rank in the Arcana skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

Your rudimentary understanding of the principle grammar of magic is sufficient to identify which lesser rune a spell or ritual may be using, as well as the gesture used (if not the inflection). You can identify whether a figure is influenced more by chaos or by order, and can spot the signs of common spirits (both lesser and greater). You know enough about religious customs to communicate with those who worship a particular spirit or deity without embarrassing yourself.

Strategic Repositioning.name: Strategic Repositioning
Strategic Repositioning.description:
You are always thinking ahead about where to position yourself should danger loom. Before Turn 1 of a Combat encounter, provided that you are not Unaware, you may immediately move 4 feet in any permitted direction.

If multiple combatants have this feature, repositioning occurs in reverse order of Initiative.

Lightbringer.name: Lightbringer
Lightbringer.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Illumination. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[irradiated] condition on Critical Hits.

The Irradiated effect lasts for 1 Round and deals your Presence score as Radiant damage to both Health and Morale.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

Versatile Translator.name: Versatile Translator
Versatile Translator.description:
You have a scholarly background in linguistics or an intuitive knack for languages. Your capabilities enable you to decipher the basic meaning of text written in a variety of languages.

You can translate text of a language you do not know that is written using a common set of glyphs or characters to a language that you do know. Creating such a translation requires spending one minute per word to transcribe the text into a language which you understand.

Your translations are rudimentary and often lack nuance, but they do contain all essential points of the text.

Iramancer.name: Iramancer
Iramancer.description: Your feats of arcana are fueled by anger. While Enraged you may still spend Focus and you deal 2 additional damage to all spell attacks.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You immediately react to a spell being cast and compose a rune and gesture designed to unravel and negate the spellcraft of an enemy mage.

Playtest Notes

This action can now be used in playtesting, but it is not yet fully automated. The Counterspell can be performed, but it is up to the Gamemaster to manually reverse a previously applied spell and to manually deduct its Action and Focus cost. These steps of the overall Counterspell workflow will be automated in a subsequent update such that a confirmed Counterspell will also confirm the spell that was countered, but with its effects removed.

counterspell.name: Counterspell
counterspell.description:
You form arcane energy into a countervailing spellcraft, targeting a spellcaster you can see within 30 feet.

Designate a Rune and Gesture which you know to attempt to counter the spell. Choosing a Rune which is opposed to one used in the spell grants +2 Boons to your attempt. Selecting the identical Gesture as the one being cast also adds +2 Boons to your attempt.

Perform a harmless Spell Attack against your target's Willpower defense. If your roll exceeds their defense, the spell is countered and its magic is nullified, producing no effects.
counterspell.condition: Another creature which you can see is casting a spell.

Flame Proficiency.name: Flame Proficiency
Flame Proficiency.description:
You have fluency in weaving spellcraft using the Rune of Flame. You gain a +1 Skill Bonus for spells cast using this Rune.

Playtest Notes

This talent will eventually also provide an upgrade to the Enkindle action, expanding its effectiveness or including new options for how to use it.

Rune: Kinesis.name: Rune: Kinesis
Rune: Kinesis.description:
The chaotic force of space and physical movement. The Kinesis rune governs all things related to the act of movement and physicality.

The Kinesis rune scales using Presence, targets Physical defense, and deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Control.

propel.name: Propel
propel.description:
Your command of the Rune of Kinesis allows you to exert local control over gravitational forces to perform basic telekinetic manipulations, producing one of the following effects:

  • Pull an unsecured object within 15 feet and with weight no greater than 1 towards you and catch it. An object that is equipped or possessed by a creature is never treated as unsecured unless that creature is willing to release it.

  • Flick an object that you hold with weight no greater than 1 towards a target up to 30 feet away. The object flies unerringly in a straight line towards that target at a moderate speed. Any creature along the object's path can react to catch it as long as they have a free hand with which to do so.

  • Suspend in midair an object or willing creature that you touch with weight less than or equal to 10 times your Presence, altering its position up to 20 feet in any direction from its original location. You can maintain this suspension indefinitely as long as you take no further Action and are not @Condition[incapacitated].

Propel may only affect a creature or object you can physically touch unless otherwise specified. You may attempt other uses similar those above, the effectiveness of which is decided by the Gamemaster.

ancestry.name: Orcish
ancestry.description: Your birth was marked by the stars and traditions of a proud and enduring people. Your tall and well-toned body and natural propensity for toughness has origins amid a people exposed to the relentless struggle of a harsh northern clime. Your people are known for their strength and resilience above all else.

background.name: Soldier
background.description: You were a rank-and-file member of a military organization of some variety. Discipline made you a survivor and emphasized the importance of demonstrating strength and dominance over others, and years on horseback or marching taught you how to handle all manner of terrain.

biography.public: Agnath is a sword-wielding necromancer who imbues deathly magic into their heavy blows. Agnath aspires to obtain the Spellblade signature talent.

Cadence.name: Cadence
Cadence.description: You are drilled in performing sequences of melee attacks with rhythmic precision. When you Strike multiple times in sequence using a one-handed melee weapon you gain a stacking +1 Boon for each successive attack.

Gesture: Arrow.name: Gesture: Arrow
Gesture: Arrow.description:
You hurl a projectile imbued with the magical power of a Rune at a distant target.

The Arrow gesture scales using Intellect and targets a single creature up to a distance of 60 feet, dealing 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 3 Action and 1 Focus.

Spellblade.name: Spellblade
Spellblade.description:
You are an arcane warrior who can weave together Strike and Spell relying on both martial and arcane techniques in battle. The physical strikes of your weaponry partially substitute for the somatic gestures of traditional spellcraft.

While wielding a Melee weapon as your mainhand weapon, spells you cast using Gesture: Strike benefit from your weapon's damage bonus.

Immediately after performing a Strike with a melee weapon, you may cast a spell with its Action cost reduced by 1.

Strong Grip.name: Strong Grip
Strong Grip.description: Your grasp of your weaponry is firm and unyielding. You can perform Actions which require a free hand while wielding a two-handed weapon. Attempts to Disarm you are made with +2 Banes.

Gesture: Strike.name: Gesture: Strike
Gesture: Strike.description:
You empower a direct close-range attack with the arcane essence of a Rune, performing a Strike with your equipped weapon.

The Strike gesture scales using Strength and deal damage based on your used weapon but with the damage type of the incorporated Rune. This gesture does not require any free hand and has a base cost of 1 Focus in addition to the cost of your weapon Strike.

Powerful Physique.name: Powerful Physique
Powerful Physique.description: You can wield weapons with the Slow trait and wear Armor with the Bulky trait without suffering Banes to your Initiative rolls.

Counter Riposte.name: Counter Riposte
Counter Riposte.description: You are expert in translating a parried attack into a swift counter against your exposed enemy.

counterRiposte.name: Counter Riposte
counterRiposte.description: When you defend against a melee attack with a Parry, you may react and expend Focus to retaliate with a reduced-cost Strike which benefits from the Exposed condition.
counterRiposte.condition: You Parry an incoming melee Strike.

Ruthless Momentum.name: Ruthless Momentum
Ruthless Momentum.description: You relish the carnage you can cause in combat and continue to press the fray as each enemy falls.

ruthlessMomentum.name: Ruthless Momentum
ruthlessMomentum.description: After defeating an enemy, you may move up to your Stride and attack another foe within melee range.
ruthlessMomentum.condition: You incapacitate an enemy with a melee attack.

Lesser Regeneration.name: Lesser Regeneration
Lesser Regeneration.description: Your prodigious hardiness conveys a supernatural capability to recover from wounds quickly. At the start of your turn if you are not Weakened you gain +1 Health.

Rune: Lightning.name: Rune: Lightning
Rune: Lightning.description:
The chaotic force of raw electrical energy. The Lightning rune governs sources of electrical charge and discharge.

The Lightning rune scales using Intellect, targets Reflex, and deals Electrical damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Earth.

Heavy Strike.name: Heavy Strike
Heavy Strike.description: You know how to use a heavy weapon to deliver punishing blows, putting your entire strength behind every swing.

heavyStrike.name: Heavy Strike
heavyStrike.description: You unleash a powerful Strike with your mainhand weapon. The attack is slower to execute, but is Empowered to deliver additional damage.

Athletics Novice.name: Athletics Novice
Athletics Novice.description:
You have received training in basic athletics. You gain the Novice rank in the Athletics skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know whether a surface can support your weight or not, how to find handholds while climbing, and how to distribute your weight for buoyancy when swimming. You know how to run for distance, and how to pace yourself to avoid exhaustion.

Intimidation Novice.name: Intimidation Novice
Intimidation Novice.description:
You understand the fundamentals of how threats and coercion can achieve desired outcomes. You gain the Novice rank in the Intimidation skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to use simple displays of violence or overt threats to get others to follow your lead, but you aren't very subtle.

Heavy Weapon Training.name: Heavy Weapon Training
Heavy Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in the use of martial weaponry. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Heavy, or Balanced categories.

Opportunistic Spellcraft.name: Opportunistic Spellcraft
Opportunistic Spellcraft.description: Your quick thinking can weave magic to exploit brief windows of opportunity. You may make a Disengagement Attack using the Touch Gesture instead of a melee weapon attack.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

Athletics Journeyman.name: Athletics Journeyman
Athletics Journeyman.description: You gain the Journeyman rank in the Athletics skill, providing a +1 Skill Bonus.

Heavy Weapon Proficiency.name: Heavy Weapon Proficiency
Heavy Weapon Proficiency.description: You have a fluent education in the use of martial weaponry. You gain the Journeyman training rank and a +1 Skill Bonus with weapons in the Simple, Heavy, and Balanced categories.

Sundering Strike.name: Sundering Strike
Sundering Strike.description: You know a martial technique to exploit the weakest points of an enemy's defenses, exposing them to further harm.

sunderingStrike.name: Sundering Strike
sunderingStrike.description: You make a Strike with your mainhand weapon which, if successful, applies the Exposed condition to your target for 3 rounds. This attack is Difficult to perform and deals reduced damage.

Rune: Flame.name: Rune: Flame
Rune: Flame.description:
The chaotic force of elemental, thermal energy. The Flame rune governs fire and heat.

The Flame rune scales using Intellect, targets Reflex, and deals Fire damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Frost.

Pyromancer.name: Pyromancer
Pyromancer.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Flame. Spells which use this Rune cause @Condition[burning] on Critical Hits.

The Burning effect lasts for 1 Round and deals your Intellect score as Fire damage to both Health and Morale.

Gesture: Blast.name: Gesture: Blast
Gesture: Blast.description:
You hurl the arcane power of a Rune into an intense explosion of energy at a nearby point you can see.

The Blast gesture scales with Intellect and produces a blast with 6 feet radius centered on a point within 60 feet of the spellcaster. The blast deals 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture requires 2 Hands to cast and has a base cost of 5 Action and 2 Focus.

Playtest Notes

This talent is currently placed at a Tier 4 node. It will eventually only be attainable at a higher level (probably Level 6 required). It is currently available "early" for testing.

ancestry.name: Human
ancestry.description: Found amid countless conditions and far-flung places, you were born an ever-adaptable human. Tall or short, thin, muscular, or rotund, your physical appearance is nothing if not varied. Humans are most known for a genetic predisposition toward determination, with traditions that drive a stubborn will to survive.

background.name: Urchin
background.description: Few learn to survive the way you did. Yours was a harsh education in distrust. You learned to watch others for the telltale signs of danger or disloyalty, to avoid the attention of others, scavenging for scraps of food on the streets of some urban sprawl.

biography.public: Belladonna is a cunning rogue who fights with two daggers, dealing a rapid sequence of blows against an unwary target. Belladonna aspires to obtain the Poisoner signature talent.

Diversionist.name: Diversionist
Diversionist.description: You specialize in using subterfuge to distract or trick your opponent during combat.

distract.name: Distract
distract.description: You make a Deception based Skill Attack against the Willpower defense of a target within 30 feet which can see or hear you. On a success, the target loses 1 Focus.

Dual Wield.name: Dual Wield
Dual Wield.description: You are adept at fighting with two weapons simultaneously. You can weave attacks together to strike more rapidly than possible with a single weapon.

offhandStrike.name: Offhand Strike
offhandStrike.description: Immediately after you perform a basic Strike with your mainhand weapon, you make a reduced-cost fullow-up Strike with your offhand weapon.

Flurry.name: Flurry
Flurry.description: A martial technique using two weapons to overwhelm a single target with a relentless sequence of attacks.

flurry.name: Flurry
flurry.description: You Strike twice with each weapon, but each strike is Difficult.

Bloodletter.name: Bloodletter
Bloodletter.description:
Your precision with weapons which deal Slashing or Piercing damage can cause the Bleeding condition on Critical Hits which deal damage to Health.

The Bleeding effect lasts for 1 round and deals your Dexterity score as additional damage to Health.

Counter Evade.name: Counter Evade
Counter Evade.description: You are practiced in evasive fighting styles which use an enemy's missed attack to devise an opening to counter-attack.

counterEvade.name: Counter Evade
counterEvade.description: When you defend against a melee attack with a Dodge, you may expend Focus to retaliate with a reduced-cost Strike using your mainhand weapon.
counterEvade.condition: You Dodge an incoming melee Strike.

Strike First.name: Strike First
Strike First.description: Shoot first, ask questions later. You gain +1 Boon on any Strike or Spell attack against an enemy whose initiative score is lower than your own.

Preternatural Instinct.name: Preternatural Instinct
Preternatural Instinct.description: Your quickness of mind and body are equally impressive. You gain +2 Boons to all Initiative checks.

Defensive Roll.name: Defensive Roll
Defensive Roll.description: You are a nimble skirmisher, always in movement to stay one step ahead of your enemies in combat.

defensiveRoll.name: Defensive Roll
defensiveRoll.description: When you Dodge a melee attack you can expend Focus to leap into a defensive roll, moving up to your Size in any direction.
defensiveRoll.condition: You Dodge an incoming melee Strike.

Skirmisher.name: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.description: You are adept at entering and exiting the fray. When moving out of the Engagement radius of an enemy, that enemy has 2 Banes to any Disengagement Strike against you.

Backstab.name: Backstab
Backstab.description: You focus your cunning instincts on exploiting the weak points of a flanked target. You identify an opportunity and strike with deadly efficiency.

backstab.name: Backstab
backstab.description: You Strike with your mainhand weapon against a Flanked target, dealing Deadly damage.
backstab.condition: You are attacking a target with the Flanked condition.

Impetus.name: Impetus
Impetus.description: You are gifted at exploiting the slowness with which others think. If you are first in Initiative order during a round of Combat, you gain +1 current and maximum Action.

Light Weapon Training.name: Light Weapon Training
Light Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in the use of finesse weaponry. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Light and Balanced categories.

Intercept.name: Intercept
Intercept.description: You protect your allies, intercepting blows that might otherwise be directed towards your companions.

intercept.name: Intercept
intercept.description:
You intercept the path of an enemy which enters your Engagement radius, immediatly moving up to your Stride to interpose yourself and block their path.

If the enemy moves out of your Engagement radius or attacks any other creature during their turn, you may make a Disengagement Strike against them.
intercept.condition: An enemy moves into or through your Engagement radius.

Stealth Novice.name: Stealth Novice
Stealth Novice.description:
You have received training in the basics of stealth, infiltration, and subterfuge. You gain the Novice rank in the Stealth skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to use light and shadow to mask your presence, to distribute your weight when walking in order to move more quietly, and you have learned a few tricks of disguise in order to blend into a crowd. You can appear unsuspicious when surrounded by others, hide in a darkened room, and can move silently enough to avoid detection by the average person.

Deception Novice.name: Deception Novice
Deception Novice.description:
You are a liar and manipulator, and deception is a skill you've practiced. You gain the Novice rank in the Deception skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to construct basic lies and cons, and the telltale signs that tend to give away poor liars. You can construct a basic forgery for most common documents, but they won't stand up to any measure of close scrutiny.

Lunge.name: Lunge
Lunge.description: You dart forward nimbly, making a strike with sudden and unexpected swiftness.

lunge.name: Lunge
lunge.description: You Strike with your mainhand weapon against a single foe with an increased range of +2 feet. The attack is Difficult, but you do not move from your current position nor does this attack provoke any Disengagement.

description.public: Thin, tapered, and made for piercing, the stiletto is a killer’s weapon — designed to slide between ribs or gaps in armor and leave barely a trace.
This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to rapidly close wounds and improve bodily health.

healingElixir.name: Healing Elixir
healingElixir.description:
Immediately recover an amount of Health dependant on the quality of the elixir.

  • Shoddy - Immediately heals 6 Health.

  • Standard - Immediately heals 12 Health.

  • Fine - Immediately heals 24 Health.

  • Superior - Immediately heals 48 Health.

  • Masterwork - Immediately heals 96 Health.

description.public: A slender phial that contains a slightly golden-colored liquid. It smells foul, but contains the alchemical agents necessary to neutralize a wide variety of toxins.

antitoxin.name: Antitoxin
antitoxin.description:
Consuming this @ref[name] is able to neutralize any @Condition[poisoned] conditions affecting the target. Stronger poisons require a stronger antitoxin to neutralize.

The category of poison negated by this @ref[name] depends on its quality:

  • Shoddy - Poisons dealing 3 damage or less per round

  • Standard - Poisons dealing 5 damage or less per round

  • Fine - Poisons dealing 7 damage or less per round

  • Superior - Poisons dealing 9 damage or less per round

  • Masterwork - Poisons dealing 11 damage or less per round

description.public: This small vial contains murky liquid that is noticeably thicker than water. It emits a disconcerting scent that evokes a sense of wrongness.

poisonIngest.name: Ingest Poison
poisonIngest.description:
When this toxin is ingested or otherwise enters the bloodstream of a creature, it is initially Harmless, but the target must defend an attack against its Fortitude or become @Condition[poisoned].

The amount of poison damage and its duration is dependent on the quality of the @ref[name]:

  • Shoddy - 2 damage for 4 rounds

  • Standard - 4 damage for 6 rounds

  • Fine - 6 damage for 8 rounds

  • Superior - 8 damage for 10 rounds

  • Masterwork - 10 damage for 12 rounds

This action should be used when the poison is ingested rather than when it is first applied.

poisonApply.name: Apply Poison
poisonApply.description:
The contents of this vial can be added to food, drink, smeared upon a bladed weapon, or combined with some alternative delivery mechanism.

This action, which consumes the available usage of the poison, should be used when it is first applied.

Medicine Novice.name: Medicine Novice
Medicine Novice.description:
You have a basic education in anatomy, physiology, and medicine. You gain the Novice rank in the Medicine skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You’ve learned the basics of treating common wounds and illnesses, and keep a running list of known alchemical and herbal compounds that can be used for treating particular illnesses. With a little time studying an injured, diseased, or otherwise ill individual you can perform a basic diagnosis and treat accordingly.

Flash of Steel.name: Flash of Steel
Flash of Steel.description: You are an expert in using a thrown weapon to imbalance or expose your target for follow-up strikes.

flashOfSteel.name: Flash of Steel
flashOfSteel.description: You make a Thrown weapon attack, targeting a weak point in your enemy's defences. If the attack hits, the target becomes Exposed until the start of their next Turn.

Anticipate Harm.name: Anticipate Harm
Anticipate Harm.description: Your keen reflexes and acuity allow you to anticipate imminent danger and react to avoid it.

anticipateHarm.name: Anticipate Harm
anticipateHarm.description: You may immediately move 4 feet after the area-of-effect of the attack is declared. If this movement escapes the area of the attack, you are unaffected.
anticipateHarm.condition: You are targeted by an area-of-effect attack, the source of which you can see.

Assassin.name: Assassin
Assassin.description:
You specialize in bringing death the the unwary. Any Strike or Spell attack against an Unaware target becomes Deadly.

An Unaware creature hit by your attack may not alert its allies until its own turn in Combat.

markForDeath.name: Mark For Death
markForDeath.description: You spend 1 minute studying a creature. Perform a Knowledge Test about your target. If successful, you learn all damage types against which the target is Vulnerable. Your minimum Initiative during the first round of Combat becomes one greater than the Initiative of your marked target.

Interrupting Throw.name: Interrupting Throw
Interrupting Throw.description: You are alert and prepared to use your equipped weapon to interrupt enemy spellcraft.

interruptingThrow.name: Interrupting Throw
interruptingThrow.description: When an enemy that you can see casts a Spell which costs 3 Action or greater, you can make a Reaction to perform a Thrown weapon attack against the caster. If your attack results in a Critical Hit the spell is interrupted and its magic is lost.
interruptingThrow.condition: An enemy you can see casts a Spell which costs 3 Action or greater.

Light Weapon Proficiency.name: Light Weapon Proficiency
Light Weapon Proficiency.description: You have a fluent education in the use of martial weaponry. You gain the Journeyman training rank and a +1 Skill Bonus with weapons in the Light and Balanced categories.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

ancestry.name: Dwarven
ancestry.description: Like your parents before you, you were born with the enduring fortitude of the Dwarves. Your stout stature and burly physical appearance are the hallmarks of a people born of earth and stone. A legacy of physical resilience is yours to inherit, for in your breast beats a heart of stone.

background.name: Constable
background.description: You were part of a law enforcement organization. You learned how to remain vigilant to your surroundings, work within complex social structures, and affect an imposing presence.

biography.public: Duurath is a stout dwarven defender who uses a hammer and shield to protect his allies and punish enemies by sapping their morale. Duurath aspires to obtain the Runewarden signature talent.

Intimidator.name: Intimidator
Intimidator.description: You specialize in exerting your intimidating presence to break the morale of your foes.

intimidate.name: Intimidate
intimidate.description: You physically intimidate an enemy that is within your engagement range, performing an Intimidation skill attack against your target. On a success they sustain Void damage to Morale.

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description: You are practiced at fighting with shield, using it to slam into and imbalance your foes.

shieldBash.name: Shield Bash
shieldBash.description: Following a basic Strike with your mainhand weapon, you Strike with your shield, causing the Staggered condition for one Round.

Second Wind.name: Second Wind
Second Wind.description: Your physical hardiness allows you to push yourself beyond conventional limits.

secondWind.name: Second Wind
secondWind.description: You focus your energy and recover your Toughness score in Health.

Gesture: Ward.name: Gesture: Ward
Gesture: Ward.description:
You shape the arcane power of a Rune into a protective barrier used to shield yourself from harm.

The Ward gesture scales using Toughness and provides +6 Resistance against the damage type of the Rune used in the spell. This resistance lasts for 1 Round and you may only have a single Ward at a time. Casting another spell using the Ward gesture replaces your prior Ward. This gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 2 Action and 1 Focus.

Body Block.name: Body Block
Body Block.description: You lean into an attack which was otherwise defended with your Armor, converting its result into a Block instead.

bodyBlock.name: Body Block
bodyBlock.description: An attack which otherwise is defended by your Armor or produced a Glancing blow is converted to a Block and deals no damage.
bodyBlock.condition: You defend against a melee attack with your Armor or as a Glance.

Counter Strike.name: Counter Strike
Counter Strike.description: You are trained to transition between defending with your shield and a swift counter-attack.

counterStrike.name: Counter Strike
counterStrike.description: When you defend against a melee attack with a Block you may expend Focus to retaliate with a reduced-cost Strike using your mainhand weapon.
counterStrike.condition: You Block an incoming melee Strike.

Runewarden.name: Runewarden
Runewarden.description:
Your mastery of the arcane makes you more resilient to elemental and spiritual harm. You gain a bonus to Resistance equal to half your Wisdom for each Elemental or Spiritual damage type where you know the Arcane Rune attuned to that damage type.

When you use the Ward gesture, the Resistance provided by your Ward also increases by half your Wisdom.

Dread Lord.name: Dread Lord
Dread Lord.description: You exude a terrible presence on the battlefield which tests the morale of nearby enemies that behold you, breaking the resolve of the weak-willed.

formidablePresence.name: Formidable Presence
formidablePresence.description: You make an Intimidation skill attack against the Willpower defense of enemies within 12 feet, dealing Void damage to Morale and causing the Frightened condition for 1 Round to those whose defense you overcome.

Rune: Kinesis.name: Rune: Kinesis
Rune: Kinesis.description:
The chaotic force of space and physical movement. The Kinesis rune governs all things related to the act of movement and physicality.

The Kinesis rune scales using Presence, targets Physical defense, and deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Control.

Rallying Cry.name: Rallying Cry
Rallying Cry.description: You are a battlefield leader, using your presence and voice to harden the resolve of your allies.

rallyingCry.name: Rallying Cry
rallyingCry.description: You emit a courageous bellow that inspires Allies within 12 feet of you to remain stalwart in the face of danger. You perform an Intimidation skill test against the Madness threshold of your allies. On a success, affected allies become @Condition[resolute] for one Round.

Bulwark.name: Bulwark
Bulwark.description:
You have expertise in using a Shield to defend yourself and others.

Once per Turn while you have a Shield equipped, you may use the Defend action at a reduced cost of 1 Action Point.

Testudo.name: Testudo
Testudo.description: You are highly skilled in using shields to adopt a defensive posture. You gain double the benefit of the Guarded condition against Weapon Attacks while wielding a shield.

Hold Fast.name: Hold Fast
Hold Fast.description: You are a calm anchor in the swirling sea of combat. When you have a Shield equipped, your Engagement increases by +1, allowing you to simultaneously engage more adjacent foes.

breakEarth.name: Break Earth
breakEarth.description: You slam Earth Breaker into the ground, knocking enemies in front of you Prone if your attack exceeds their Reflex defense.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

Intimidation Novice.name: Intimidation Novice
Intimidation Novice.description:
You understand the fundamentals of how threats and coercion can achieve desired outcomes. You gain the Novice rank in the Intimidation skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to use simple displays of violence or overt threats to get others to follow your lead, but you aren't very subtle.

Unarmed Combat Training.name: Unarmed Combat Training
Unarmed Combat Training.description: You have a basic education in hand-to-hand combat and other martial arts. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Unarmed category.

Intercept.name: Intercept
Intercept.description: You protect your allies, intercepting blows that might otherwise be directed towards your companions.

intercept.name: Intercept
intercept.description:
You intercept the path of an enemy which enters your Engagement radius, immediatly moving up to your Stride to interpose yourself and block their path.

If the enemy moves out of your Engagement radius or attacks any other creature during their turn, you may make a Disengagement Strike against them.
intercept.condition: An enemy moves into or through your Engagement radius.

Shield Ward.name: Shield Ward
Shield Ward.description: You have mastered a specialized technique to incorporate a physical shield into the Ward gesture. You may ignore the free-hand requirement for spells using the Ward gesture while you have a Shield equipped.

Heavy Weapon Training.name: Heavy Weapon Training
Heavy Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in the use of martial weaponry. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Heavy, or Balanced categories.

Athletics Novice.name: Athletics Novice
Athletics Novice.description:
You have received training in basic athletics. You gain the Novice rank in the Athletics skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know whether a surface can support your weight or not, how to find handholds while climbing, and how to distribute your weight for buoyancy when swimming. You know how to run for distance, and how to pace yourself to avoid exhaustion.

Armored Shell.name: Armored Shell
Armored Shell.description:
You are expert in using your armor in combination with your shield to create a defensive shell.

When you have the Guarded condition and have a Heavy Shield equipped, your base Armor defense is reduced by half but your Block defense increases by a corresponding amount.

Shield Combat Training.name: Shield Combat Training
Shield Combat Training.description: You have a basic education in the usage of shields in combat. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Shield category.

Shield Combat Proficiency.name: Shield Combat Proficiency
Shield Combat Proficiency.description: You have a fluent education in the use of shields in combat. You gain the Journeyman training rank and a +1 Skill Bonus with weapons in the Shield category.

description.public: A slightly curved bar of strong metal featuring a hook with a flattened head on one end. Used to apply leverage, prying one object loose of another.
This potion contains a specialized alchemical formula to rapidly close wounds and improve bodily health.

healingElixir.name: Healing Elixir
healingElixir.description:
Immediately recover an amount of Health dependant on the quality of the elixir.

  • Shoddy - Immediately heals 6 Health.

  • Standard - Immediately heals 12 Health.

  • Fine - Immediately heals 24 Health.

  • Superior - Immediately heals 48 Health.

  • Masterwork - Immediately heals 96 Health.

description.public:
An expanded toolbelt in the form of a utility belt, a bandolier, or an array of pockets stitched into your equipment.

This item provides a number of additional Toolbelt slots according to its quality tier:

  • Standard: +1 Toolbelt slot

  • Fine: +2 Toolbelt slots

  • Superior: +3 Toolbelt slots

  • Masterwork: +4 Toolbelt slots

ancestry.name: Elvish
ancestry.description: Graceful in movement and swift in thought, you were born a long-lived elf. Your slight and nimble frame and sculpted features are the inherited traits of a people for whom elegance is a way of life. Your predisposition toward quick-thinking and precise movement the evolutionary results of hundreds of years of tradition.

background.name: Wanderer
background.description: Yours has been an itinerant life. You enjoy nothing more than the feeling of a cart or mount below you, watching some foreign sky slowly pass above you. You learned to pay careful attention to your surroundings and their needs, to tend the creatures on which you rely, and to make do with what you can find.

biography.public: Eliorwen is a nimble skirmisher who uses archery and spellcraft to suppress and eliminates foes from a tremendous distnace. Eliorwen aspires to obtain the Arcane Archer signature talent.

Pinning Shot.name: Pinning Shot
Pinning Shot.description: You fire a tactically placed shot to pin your target against a nearby surface.

pinningShot.name: Pinning Shot
pinningShot.description: You Strike from distance. The attack is Difficult, however if your target is it it becomes Restrained until the end of their next Turn.

Arcane Archer.name: Arcane Archer
Arcane Archer.description:
Your skill with archery can shape your spellcraft, partially substituting for the somatic gestures of traditional spellcasting.

While using a Projectile weapon as your mainhand weapon, you ignore the free-hand requirement for casting spells using the Arrow gesture and the range of those spells becomes your weapon range.

Immediately after performing a Strike with a projectile weapon, you may cast a spell with its Action cost reduced by 1.

Weak Points.name: Weak Points
Weak Points.description: You identify moments of opportunity to strike at an enemy's weak points. When attacking a target that is Unaware, Flanked, or Exposed using Finesse weaponry, you gain +2 damage to any Strike.

Mark Prey.name: Mark Prey
Mark Prey.description: You fire a special shot which deals reduced damage, but explodes in luminous powder clearly marking your target.

markPrey.name: Mark Prey
markPrey.description: You Strike using a special shot. If your attack is successful the target is Exposed for the next 3 Turns.

Evasive Shot.name: Evasive Shot
Evasive Shot.description: You are an expert at firing shots with ranged weaponry while evading enemy attacks. After performing a ranged weapon attack, you gain half your Stride in additional free movement.

Gesture: Arrow.name: Gesture: Arrow
Gesture: Arrow.description:
You hurl a projectile imbued with the magical power of a Rune at a distant target.

The Arrow gesture scales using Intellect and targets a single creature up to a distance of 60 feet, dealing 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 3 Action and 1 Focus.

Rune: Lightning.name: Rune: Lightning
Rune: Lightning.description:
The chaotic force of raw electrical energy. The Lightning rune governs sources of electrical charge and discharge.

The Lightning rune scales using Intellect, targets Reflex, and deals Electrical damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Earth.

Precision Shot.name: Precision Shot
Precision Shot.description: You take time to steady your aim and target the weakest point of a foe. You may only get one shot, but you make it count.

precisionShot.name: Precision Shot
precisionShot.description: You steady your aim and fire a single accurate shot.

Wilderness Novice.name: Wilderness Novice
Wilderness Novice.description:
You have received training in the basics of wilderness survival and traversal. You gain the Novice rank in the Wilderness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to find and construct safe shelter from the elements, to start a fire for warmth, to keep cool in hot environments. You can find safe, drinkable water in most places, and how to identify which plants and animals can serve as safe food sources.

Athletics Novice.name: Athletics Novice
Athletics Novice.description:
You have received training in basic athletics. You gain the Novice rank in the Athletics skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know whether a surface can support your weight or not, how to find handholds while climbing, and how to distribute your weight for buoyancy when swimming. You know how to run for distance, and how to pace yourself to avoid exhaustion.

Projectile Weapon Training.name: Projectile Weapon Training
Projectile Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in archery and other projectile weaponry. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Projectile categories.

Stealth Novice.name: Stealth Novice
Stealth Novice.description:
You have received training in the basics of stealth, infiltration, and subterfuge. You gain the Novice rank in the Stealth skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to use light and shadow to mask your presence, to distribute your weight when walking in order to move more quietly, and you have learned a few tricks of disguise in order to blend into a crowd. You can appear unsuspicious when surrounded by others, hide in a darkened room, and can move silently enough to avoid detection by the average person.

Fan of Arrows.name: Fan of Arrows
Fan of Arrows.description: This difficult ranged weaponry technique allows you to fire a multiple shots with your weapon in a sweeping cone, each targeting a different enemy in the area of effect.

fanOfArrows.name: Fan of Arrows
fanOfArrows.description: You fire multiple projectiles from your ranged weapon in an arc, striking all enemy targets within a 40 foot cone.

Twinned Shot.name: Twinned Shot
Twinned Shot.description: You prepare two shots to fire simultaneously at a single target.

twinnedShot.name: Twinned Shot
twinnedShot.description: Using this Difficult technique, you fire two projectiles at once making two Strike attacks against the same target.

Projectile Weapon Proficiency.name: Projectile Weapon Proficiency
Projectile Weapon Proficiency.description: You have a fluent education in the use of projectile weaponry. You gain the Journeyman training rank and a +1 Skill Bonus with weapons in the Projectile category.

Gesture: Step.name: Gesture: Step
Gesture: Step.description:
You infuse runic power into a movement, crossing physical and spatial boundaries.

The Step gesture scales with Dexterity and allows you to move up to 20 feet in a straight line with width equal to your Size. It deals 2 Base Damage to targets along that line which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture does not require any free hands to cast and has a base cost of 3 Action and 1 Focus.

Playtest Notes

The movement aspect of this talent is not yet automated and must be manually performed as a consequence of the spell.

Skirmisher.name: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.description: You are adept at entering and exiting the fray. When moving out of the Engagement radius of an enemy, that enemy has 2 Banes to any Disengagement Strike against you.

Diversionist.name: Diversionist
Diversionist.description: You specialize in using subterfuge to distract or trick your opponent during combat.

distract.name: Distract
distract.description: You make a Deception based Skill Attack against the Willpower defense of a target within 30 feet which can see or hear you. On a success, the target loses 1 Focus.

Surgeweaver.name: Surgeweaver
Surgeweaver.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Lightning. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[shocked] condition on Critical Hits.

The Shocked effect lasts for 1 Round, deals half your Intellect score as Lightning damage to Morale, and applies the @Condition[staggered] condition.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

Rune: Illusion.name: Rune: Illusion
Rune: Illusion.description:
The chaotic force of trickery and whimsy. The illusion rune governs magical manifestations of falsehood or misdirection.

The Illusion rune scales using Intellect, targets Willpower defense, and deals Psychic damage to Morale. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Illumination.

seeming.name: Seeming
seeming.description:
Your command of the Rune of Illusion allows you to fabricate perception in various simple ways and to manipulate shadow and light to create distraction or entertainment, producing one of the following effects:

  • Modify a single aspect of your own physical appearance. Such alterations might include adjusting the sound of your voice, changing the color of your eyes, gaining illusory horns, or appearing slightly taller or shorter. The alteration persists until you Rest or enact a different alteration and can be verified as illusory by physical inspection.

  • Manifest a convincing recreation of a short sound or single scent that you can clearly recall. The illusion originates from your position and lasts for 10 seconds. You can control the volume of the sound or odorousness of the scent to be perceptible up to a range of 60 feet or shorter.

  • Decouple your shadow from your form, specifically controlling its movements separately from your own. You can maintain this illusion as long as you do not perform any other action that consumes Focus.

Seeming may only affect a creature or object you can physically touch. You may attempt other uses similar those above, the effectiveness of which is decided by the Gamemaster.

Subtle Extrication.name: Subtle Extrication
Subtle Extrication.description: You understand how to move away from an opponent without exposing yourself to the worst attacks in return. Any Disengagement Attack against you is performed without the 2 Boons that would ordinarily apply to such an attack.

Focused Anticipation.name: Focused Anticipation
Focused Anticipation.description: Anticipation leads to decisive action. When you have the highest Initiative score for a Round of combat, you gain +1 Focus.

description.public: A flask filled with a reddish liquid explodes when it breaks open, creating a small explosive fire that quickly dissipates.
description.private: Primarily used to break apart large pieces of ore, these alchemical flasks pack a concentrated punch. If combined in a large enough quantity, they can also be used to create a chain reaction that results in larger explosions.

blastFlask.name: Blast Flask
blastFlask.description:
You light and throw the @ref[name], dealing Fire damage to all enemies in the radius of the explosion. The radius of the Blast depends on the quality of the bomb:

  • Shoddy - 3 feet

  • Standard - 4 feet

  • Fine - 6 feet

  • Superior - 8 feet

  • Masterwork - 10 feet

Perspicacity.name: Perspicacity
Perspicacity.description: You have heightened insight into aspects of your surroundings. You gain +2 Boons to any Awareness skill test which does not rely upon eyesight.

ancestry.name: Gnome
ancestry.description: Yours was a birth of exuberant celebration. Your diminutive body and delicate features are paired with an almost supernatural propensity for discovery. The traditions of your people embrace a lust for life and the importance of quick-thinking and quick-action.

background.name: Scholar
background.description: You were always most at home in a library or classroom. Your studies focused on unravelling the mysteries of the world around you, and there are few theoretical subjects with which you are not already familiar.

biography.public: Fizzit is a clever spellcrafter and scholar who slings spells from a distance and seeks to harness elemental forces to work in their service. Fizzit aspires to obtain the Conjurer signature talent.

Intuit Weakness.name: Intuit Weakness
Intuit Weakness.description:
You calm your mind and study the physiology of your foe, seeking a vulnerability in its defenses.

Perform a Knowledge Test using an appropriate Skill chosen by the Gamemaster. On a success, you learn the Damage type that the creature has the greatest vulnerability towards, if any. On a Critical Success you learn the two Damage types which have the largest vulnerability.

intuitWeakness.name: Intuit Weakness
intuitWeakness.description: You still your mind and study the physiology of your foe, attempting to identify a vulnerability in its defenses.

Rune: Lightning.name: Rune: Lightning
Rune: Lightning.description:
The chaotic force of raw electrical energy. The Lightning rune governs sources of electrical charge and discharge.

The Lightning rune scales using Intellect, targets Reflex, and deals Electrical damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Earth.

Gesture: Arrow.name: Gesture: Arrow
Gesture: Arrow.description:
You hurl a projectile imbued with the magical power of a Rune at a distant target.

The Arrow gesture scales using Intellect and targets a single creature up to a distance of 60 feet, dealing 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 3 Action and 1 Focus.

Gesture: Create.name: Gesture: Create
Gesture: Create.description:
You coalesce arcane power into tangible form, manifesting a Sprite which appears within 10 feet and joins Combat at Initiative 1. Your Sprite is a Minion of half your own Level.

The Create gesture scales with Wisdom and the Sprite survives for 6 Rounds. You may only have one active Sprite, casting another spell using the Create gesture replaces your previous Sprite. This gesture requires 2 Hands to cast and has a base cost of 4 Action and 1 Focus.

Playtest Notes

Not all Runes have a Sprite actor defined yet. Runes that do not yet have a defined Creation will — for now — manifest a Flame Sprite.

Inflection: Compose.name: Inflection: Compose
Inflection: Compose.description: Enhance a spell by taking extra time in its formation, reducing other resource costs in exchange. The Compose inflection reduces the Focus cost of a spell by 1 while increasing its Action cost by 1 in exchange.

Conjurer.name: Conjurer
Conjurer.description: You are a master of Conjuration and the Gesture of Creation to manifest arcane energy as physical form. You can maintain up to 3 such creations simultaneously rather than only one.

Rimecaller.name: Rimecaller
Rimecaller.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Frost. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[freezing] condition on Critical Hits.

The Freezing effect lasts for 1 Round, deals half your Wisdom score as Frost damage to Health, and applies the @Condition[slowed] condition.

Recognize Spellcraft.name: Recognize Spellcraft
Recognize Spellcraft.description: You can interpret the arcane incantations of others to discern the nature of their spellcraft. When an enemy within 40 feet that you can see and hear begins casting a spell, you can identify its Rune if you also know that Rune.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
You immediately react to a spell being cast and compose a rune and gesture designed to unravel and negate the spellcraft of an enemy mage.

Playtest Notes

This action can now be used in playtesting, but it is not yet fully automated. The Counterspell can be performed, but it is up to the Gamemaster to manually reverse a previously applied spell and to manually deduct its Action and Focus cost. These steps of the overall Counterspell workflow will be automated in a subsequent update such that a confirmed Counterspell will also confirm the spell that was countered, but with its effects removed.

counterspell.name: Counterspell
counterspell.description:
You form arcane energy into a countervailing spellcraft, targeting a spellcaster you can see within 30 feet.

Designate a Rune and Gesture which you know to attempt to counter the spell. Choosing a Rune which is opposed to one used in the spell grants +2 Boons to your attempt. Selecting the identical Gesture as the one being cast also adds +2 Boons to your attempt.

Perform a harmless Spell Attack against your target's Willpower defense. If your roll exceeds their defense, the spell is countered and its magic is nullified, producing no effects.
counterspell.condition: Another creature which you can see is casting a spell.

Arcana Novice.name: Arcana Novice
Arcana Novice.description:
Your education covered the fundamentals of metaphysics and magical theory, the relationship between the runes, the opposing nature of order and chaos, and a cursory introduction to spiritual beings including the most commonly known deified and demonized figures of worship. You gain the Novice rank in the Arcana skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

Your rudimentary understanding of the principle grammar of magic is sufficient to identify which lesser rune a spell or ritual may be using, as well as the gesture used (if not the inflection). You can identify whether a figure is influenced more by chaos or by order, and can spot the signs of common spirits (both lesser and greater). You know enough about religious customs to communicate with those who worship a particular spirit or deity without embarrassing yourself.

Science Novice.name: Science Novice
Science Novice.description:
You've learned to study the world around you through structured observation, mathematics, physics, chemistry, and other disciplines. You gain the Novice rank in the Science skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You are familiar with the basic principles of mathematics, physics, chemistry, or other scientific studies. You know how to construct and use simple machines for the purposes of making physical tasks easier. You know some of the more commonly understood scientific theories, and given suitable time to study more complex machines you might be able to at least operate them.

Mechanical Weapon Training.name: Mechanical Weapon Training
Mechanical Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in crossbows, firearms, and other mechanical weapons. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Mechanical category.

Rune: Kinesis.name: Rune: Kinesis
Rune: Kinesis.description:
The chaotic force of space and physical movement. The Kinesis rune governs all things related to the act of movement and physicality.

The Kinesis rune scales using Presence, targets Physical defense, and deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage to Health. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Control.

Irrepressible Spirit.name: Irrepressible Spirit
Irrepressible Spirit.description: Your tenacity gives you an irrepressible spirit which resists the onset of despair. At the start of your turn if you are not Broken you gain 1 Morale.

Tactician.name: Tactician
Tactician.description: You are a cunning battlefield tactician, able to organize and direct your allies to act with increased effectiveness.

tacticalPlan.name: Tactical Plan
tacticalPlan.description: Using 10 words or fewer, describe a course of action to an ally who acts after you in Initiative order. If that ally carries out your described plan later in the same Round, they gain +2 Boons on any dice rolls associated with that plan. The Gamemaster may arbitrate whether or not the plan was followed.

Wildspeaker.name: Wildspeaker
Wildspeaker.description: You have a preternatural knack for communicating with animals. Through body language and sounds, you are capable of interpreting and communicating in the language of the wilderness.

wildspeak.name: Wildspeak
wildspeak.description:
If you succeed on a [[/skillCheck wilderness 14]] check, you may pose simple questions to a Beast which can perceive you. As long as the creature is not hostile it will respond accurately within the limits of its own knowledge.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score of zero are incapable of understanding you.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score of 1 can only respond with "yes" or "no" responses.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score greater than 1 can provide simple multi-word responses.

Mental Fortress.name: Mental Fortress
Mental Fortress.description: Your strong will makes you exceedingly difficult to influence. You gain +1 to your Willpower defense and +5 resistance to Psychic damage.

Rune: Frost.name: Rune: Frost
Rune: Frost.description:
The orderly force of water and cold. The Frost rune governs the creation of water or other fluids and their transfer between liquid and frozen states.

The Frost rune scales using Wisdom, targets Fortitude, and deals Cold damage to Health. It is opposed by the chaotic rune of Flame.

Rune: Control.name: Rune: Control
Rune: Control.description:
The orderly force of discipline and permanence. The Control rune governs thought, reason, and persistence.

The Control rune scales using Intellect, targets Willpower, and deals Psychic damage to Morale. It is opposed by the chaotic rune of Kinesis.

motivate.name: Motivate
motivate.description:
Your command of the Rune of Control allows you to affect the decision making of others in basic ways, producing one of the following effects:

  • Moderately intensify or dampen the primary emotion being felt by a creature you touch. If the creature is intelligent enough to be aware of the laws governing spellcraft, they are aware of your actions.

  • Understand the abstract motivations of another living creature which allows you to touch it. You are able to intuit their immediate goals expressed in the form of a single verb.

  • Intensely focus on your current objective and the means of achieving it. You receive a brief hint or reminder from the Gamemaster about that objective containing only information which you have previously learned.

Motivate may only affect a creature or object which you can physically touch. You may attempt other uses similar those above, the effectiveness of which is decided by the Gamemaster.

Rune: Illusion.name: Rune: Illusion
Rune: Illusion.description:
The chaotic force of trickery and whimsy. The illusion rune governs magical manifestations of falsehood or misdirection.

The Illusion rune scales using Intellect, targets Willpower defense, and deals Psychic damage to Morale. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Illumination.

seeming.description:

Such alterations might include adjusting the sound of your voice, changing the color of your eyes, gaining illusory horns, or appearing slightly taller or shorter. The alteration persists until you Rest or enact a different alteration and can be verified as illusory by physical inspection.

  • Manifest a convincing recreation of a short sound or single scent that you can clearly recall. The illusion originates from your position and lasts for 10 seconds. You can control the volume of the sound or odorousness of the scent to be perceptible up to a range of 60 feet or shorter.

  • Decouple your shadow from your form, specifically controlling its movements separately from your own. You can maintain this illusion as long as you do not perform any other action that consumes Focus.

Seeming may only affect a creature or object you can physically touch. You may attempt other uses similar those above, the effectiveness of which is decided by the Gamemaster.

Surgeweaver.description:
