The Shocked effect lasts for 1 Round, deals half your Intellect score as Lightning damage to Morale, and applies the @Condition[staggered] condition.

Mesmer.name: Mesmer
Mesmer.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Illusion. Spells which use this Rune cause @Condition[confused] on Critical Hits.

The Confused effect lasts for 1 Round, deals half your Intellect score as Psychic damage to Morale, and applies the @Condition[disoriented] condition.

ancestry.name: Giantkin
ancestry.description: Elemental forces presided over your birth, instilling you with supernatural vigor. Your large frame and muscular build often lead others to believe you are an unthinking mass of muscle, but yours is a people known most for their physical resilience and the deep well of their knowledge. You have inherited the strength of mountains.

background.name: Physician
background.description: You were a healer or medical professional of some variety. You have spent a portion of your life learning medical science, and you have a propensity for noticing illness in others. You know how to treat wounds, diseases, and how to identify their sources.

biography.public: Kagura is a stalwart healer who bolsters the health and morale of her allies amidst the frenzy of battle. Kagura aspires to obtain the Healer signature Talent.

Gesture: Influence.name: Gesture: Influence
Gesture: Influence.description:
You intensify the arcane power of a Rune into a concentrated direct contact which is generally a more powerful evolution of the basic Touch gesture.

The Influence gesture scales using Presence and targets a single adjacent creature. It deals 10 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. This gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 3 Action and 1 Focus.

Gesture: Ray.name: Gesture: Ray
Gesture: Ray.description:
You funnel the arcane power of a Rune into a point and project it outwards in a beam.

The Ray gesture scales using Wisdom and produces a line that is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long originating from the spellcaster, dealing 6 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. The gesture requires 1 Hand to cast and has a base cost of 4 Action and 1 Focus.

Conserve Effort.name: Conserve Effort
Conserve Effort.description: You find calmness and focus in conserving your effort in battle. When you end your Turn with un-spent Action you gain +1 Focus.

Healer.name: Healer
Healer.description: You are unparalleled at manipulating vital arcana to treat injuries. You learn Rune: Life if you do not already know it. When healing allies using the Rune of Life you gain +2 Boons to your roll.

fontOfLife.name: Font of Life
fontOfLife.description: You bring forth an aura of life-giving magic. Immediately upon activation and at the start of your turn for 3 Rounds every ally within 20 feet heals for an amount equal to your Wisdom score.

Mental Fortress.name: Mental Fortress
Mental Fortress.description: Your strong will makes you exceedingly difficult to influence. You gain +1 to your Willpower defense and +5 resistance to Psychic damage.

Inflection: Compose.name: Inflection: Compose
Inflection: Compose.description: Enhance a spell by taking extra time in its formation, reducing other resource costs in exchange. The Compose inflection reduces the Focus cost of a spell by 1 while increasing its Action cost by 1 in exchange.

Rune: Earth.name: Rune: Earth
Rune: Earth.description:
The orderly force of elemental earth, responsible for physical matter. The Earth rune governs minerals, metals, soils, and other physical compounds.

The Earth rune scales using Wisdom, targets Reflex, and deals Acid damage to Health. It is opposed by the chaotic rune of Lightning.

Dustbinder.name: Dustbinder
Dustbinder.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Earth. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[corroding] condition on Critical Hits.

The Corroding effect lasts for 3 Rounds and deals your Wisdom score as Acid damage to Health each Round.

Medicine Novice.name: Medicine Novice
Medicine Novice.description:
You have a basic education in anatomy, physiology, and medicine. You gain the Novice rank in the Medicine skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You’ve learned the basics of treating common wounds and illnesses, and keep a running list of known alchemical and herbal compounds that can be used for treating particular illnesses. With a little time studying an injured, diseased, or otherwise ill individual you can perform a basic diagnosis and treat accordingly.

Science Novice.name: Science Novice
Science Novice.description:
You've learned to study the world around you through structured observation, mathematics, physics, chemistry, and other disciplines. You gain the Novice rank in the Science skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You are familiar with the basic principles of mathematics, physics, chemistry, or other scientific studies. You know how to construct and use simple machines for the purposes of making physical tasks easier. You know some of the more commonly understood scientific theories, and given suitable time to study more complex machines you might be able to at least operate them.

Talisman Weapon Training.name: Talisman Weapon Training
Talisman Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in the use of talismans, orbs, foci, or other similar weapons. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Talisman categories.

Runewarden.name: Runewarden
Runewarden.description:
Your mastery of the arcane makes you more resilient to elemental and spiritual harm. You gain a bonus to Resistance equal to half your Wisdom for each Elemental or Spiritual damage type where you know the Arcane Rune attuned to that damage type.

When you use the Ward gesture, the Resistance provided by your Ward also increases by half your Wisdom.

Wildspeaker.name: Wildspeaker
Wildspeaker.description: You have a preternatural knack for communicating with animals. Through body language and sounds, you are capable of interpreting and communicating in the language of the wilderness.

wildspeak.name: Wildspeak
wildspeak.description:
If you succeed on a [[/skillCheck wilderness 14]] check, you may pose simple questions to a Beast which can perceive you. As long as the creature is not hostile it will respond accurately within the limits of its own knowledge.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score of zero are incapable of understanding you.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score of 1 can only respond with "yes" or "no" responses.

  • Beasts with an Intellect score greater than 1 can provide simple multi-word responses.

description.public: A commonly known recipe for creating a basic healing potion.
description.private: You can turn particular healing herbs found in the wild into a bottled elixir using Alchemists Tools.

Versatile Translator.name: Versatile Translator
Versatile Translator.description:
You have a scholarly background in linguistics or an intuitive knack for languages. Your capabilities enable you to decipher the basic meaning of text written in a variety of languages.

You can translate text of a language you do not know that is written using a common set of glyphs or characters to a language that you do know. Creating such a translation requires spending one minute per word to transcribe the text into a language which you understand.

Your translations are rudimentary and often lack nuance, but they do contain all essential points of the text.

Soothe.name: Soothe
Soothe.description: You administer a soothing Performance which rallies your allies, restoring Morale.

soothe.name: Soothe
soothe.description: You perform a calming verse, benefiting all allies who can perceive you within 12 feet. Make a Performance Check against the Madness threshold of each ally. On success, each ally's Morale is restored.

Gesture: Pulse.name: Gesture: Pulse
Gesture: Pulse.description:
Expel the arcane power of a Rune in a radius that travels outward with you at its center.

The Pulse gesture scales using Presence and produces an emanation with 10 foot radius, dealing 8 Base Damage to targets which fail to Resist the spell. The gesture requires 2 Hands to cast and has a base cost of 5 Action and 2 Focus.

Playtest Notes

This talent is currently placed at a Tier 4 node. It will eventually only be attainable at a higher level (probably Level 6 required). It is currently available "early" for testing.

Inspirator.name: Inspirator
Inspirator.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Soul. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[inspired] condition on Critical Hits.

The Inspired effect lasts for 1 Round and deals your Presence score as additional Restoration to Morale.

Mender.name: Mender
Mender.description:
You are highly skilled in weaving the Rune of Life. Spells which use this Rune cause the @Condition[mending] condition on Critical Hits.

The Mending effect lasts for 1 Round and deals your Wisdom score as additional Restoration to Health.

Arcana Novice.name: Arcana Novice
Arcana Novice.description:
Your education covered the fundamentals of metaphysics and magical theory, the relationship between the runes, the opposing nature of order and chaos, and a cursory introduction to spiritual beings including the most commonly known deified and demonized figures of worship. You gain the Novice rank in the Arcana skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

Your rudimentary understanding of the principle grammar of magic is sufficient to identify which lesser rune a spell or ritual may be using, as well as the gesture used (if not the inflection). You can identify whether a figure is influenced more by chaos or by order, and can spot the signs of common spirits (both lesser and greater). You know enough about religious customs to communicate with those who worship a particular spirit or deity without embarrassing yourself.

Rune: Life.name: Rune: Life
Rune: Life.description:
A chaotic force of creation, responsible for living matter. The Life rune governs health and matters relating to biological growth.

The Life rune scales using Wisdom and provides Restoration of Health or inflicts Poison damage opposed by Fortitude. It is opposed by the orderly rune of Death.

Rune: Soul.name: Rune: Soul
Rune: Soul.description:
An orderly force of creation and spiritual essence. The Soul rune governs the fundamental procession of souls through life and death and relates to matters of sapience, personality, and mental health.

The Soul rune scales using Presence and provides Restoration of Morale or inflicts Psychic damage opposed by Willpower. It is opposed by the chaotic rune of Oblivion.

evoke.name: Evoke
evoke.description:
Your command of the Rune of Soul allows you to facilitate basic forms of spiritual influence, producing one of the following effects:

  • Enable yourself or another willing person to revisit a core memory of a moment from their past up to one minute in duration as if it happened recently.

  • Identify a negative spiritual condition that is affecting a person such as @Condition[broken], @Condition[frightened], @Condition[confused], or @Condition[insane].

  • Create a momentary spiritual connection with another willing creature that allows them to recognize an idea which can be expressed as a single word.

Uses of Evoke may only affect yourself or another creature which you can physically touch. You may attempt other uses similar those above, the effectiveness of which is decided by the Gamemaster.

Irrepressible Spirit.name: Irrepressible Spirit
Irrepressible Spirit.description: Your tenacity gives you an irrepressible spirit which resists the onset of despair. At the start of your turn if you are not Broken you gain 1 Morale.

Eye of the Storm.name: Eye of the Storm
Eye of the Storm.description:
After you Delay your Turn, gain +2 Boons on any Strike or Spell attack against an enemy that you allowed to act before you that Round.

TODO: Needs automation. For now apply boons manually.

ancestry.name: Human
ancestry.description: Found amid countless conditions and far-flung places, you were born an ever-adaptable human. Tall or short, thin, muscular, or rotund, your physical appearance is nothing if not varied. Humans are most known for a genetic predisposition toward determination, with traditions that drive a stubborn will to survive.

background.name: Constable
background.description: You were part of a law enforcement organization. You learned how to remain vigilant to your surroundings, work within complex social structures, and affect an imposing presence.

biography.public: Ulfen is a fierce warrior who fights with a two-handed greataxe, favoring heavy blows that do significant damage or hit multiple targets. Ulfen aspires to obtain the Berserker signature talent.

Intimidator.name: Intimidator
Intimidator.description: You specialize in exerting your intimidating presence to break the morale of your foes.

intimidate.name: Intimidate
intimidate.description: You physically intimidate an enemy that is within your engagement range, performing an Intimidation skill attack against your target. On a success they sustain Void damage to Morale.

Uppercut.name: Uppercut
Uppercut.description: A two-handed weapon technique where you swing your weapon upwards, making a second Strike with the backswing of your weapon.

uppercut.name: Uppercut
uppercut.description: Following a basic Strike attack which did not critically miss, you Strike the same target again with the backswing of your weapon at reduced Action cost.

Cleave.name: Cleave
Cleave.description: This martial technique is a specialized two-handed fighting maneuver which relies upon brute strength to swing your weapon in a wide arc, hitting multiple enemies in its path.

cleave.name: Cleave
cleave.description: A ferocious two-handed swing cleaves through foes in a 120 degree arc.

Powerful Physique.name: Powerful Physique
Powerful Physique.description: You can wield weapons with the Slow trait and wear Armor with the Bulky trait without suffering Banes to your Initiative rolls.

Berserker.name: Berserker
Berserker.description: You revel in the thrill of combat, hurling yourself into the fray with reckless abandon.

berserkerRage.name: Berserker Rage
berserkerRage.description: You become Enraged. While Enraged you deal 4 additional damage on all melee attacks. You may attempt to end the effect on your own turn by succeeding on a Willpower test against a DC of 20. The effect ends automatically when Combat is concluded.
berserkerRage.condition: You have suffered damage to your Health pool since your last turn in Combat.

Strong Grip.name: Strong Grip
Strong Grip.description: Your grasp of your weaponry is firm and unyielding. You can perform Actions which require a free hand while wielding a two-handed weapon. Attempts to Disarm you are made with +2 Banes.

Wrestler.name: Wrestler
Wrestler.description: You are able to subdue opponents using your physical Strength.

grapple.name: Grapple
grapple.description: Perform a Athletics skill attack against an adjacent target. If successful, both you and your target are Restrained for 1 Round.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description: Your battle lust spurs you to feats of heightened action. When you achieve a Critical Hit that deals damage to Health you immediately gain +1 Action. This benefit may only happen once per Round.

Executioner's Strike.name: Executioner's Strike
Executioner's Strike.description: You deliver a single decisive strike against a wounded enemy.

executionersStrike.name: Executioner's Strike
executionersStrike.description: You deliver a Deadly Strike with a two-handed heavy weapon. If your attack is successful, your opponent also suffers the Bleeding condition for 3 Rounds, taking additional damage each Round equal to your Strength score.

Unshakeable Stance.name: Unshakeable Stance
Unshakeable Stance.description: You cannot be unvoluntarily Moved or knocked Prone by any action that is not a Critical Success rolled by an enemy or a Critical Failure rolled by yourself.

Ruthless Momentum.name: Ruthless Momentum
Ruthless Momentum.description: You relish the carnage you can cause in combat and continue to press the fray as each enemy falls.

ruthlessMomentum.name: Ruthless Momentum
ruthlessMomentum.description: After defeating an enemy, you may move up to your Stride and attack another foe within melee range.
ruthlessMomentum.condition: You incapacitate an enemy with a melee attack.

Second Wind.name: Second Wind
Second Wind.description: Your physical hardiness allows you to push yourself beyond conventional limits.

secondWind.name: Second Wind
secondWind.description: You focus your energy and recover your Toughness score in Health.

Intercept.name: Intercept
Intercept.description: You protect your allies, intercepting blows that might otherwise be directed towards your companions.

intercept.name: Intercept
intercept.description:
You intercept the path of an enemy which enters your Engagement radius, immediatly moving up to your Stride to interpose yourself and block their path.

If the enemy moves out of your Engagement radius or attacks any other creature during their turn, you may make a Disengagement Strike against them.
intercept.condition: An enemy moves into or through your Engagement radius.

Awareness Novice.name: Awareness Novice
Awareness Novice.description:
You have been trained in the basics of situational awareness, and are able to notice important details about your environment. You gain the Novice rank in the Awareness skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know to check for exits when you enter a room, and how to look for concealed weapons, hidden traps, and other threats. You know how to spot when you are being followed, and how to search for common hiding places.

Intimidation Novice.name: Intimidation Novice
Intimidation Novice.description:
You understand the fundamentals of how threats and coercion can achieve desired outcomes. You gain the Novice rank in the Intimidation skill and are no longer considered Untrained in that skill.

You know how to use simple displays of violence or overt threats to get others to follow your lead, but you aren't very subtle.

Unarmed Combat Training.name: Unarmed Combat Training
Unarmed Combat Training.description: You have a basic education in hand-to-hand combat and other martial arts. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Unarmed category.

Sundering Strike.name: Sundering Strike
Sundering Strike.description: You know a martial technique to exploit the weakest points of an enemy's defenses, exposing them to further harm.

sunderingStrike.name: Sundering Strike
sunderingStrike.description: You make a Strike with your mainhand weapon which, if successful, applies the Exposed condition to your target for 3 rounds. This attack is Difficult to perform and deals reduced damage.

Heavy Weapon Training.name: Heavy Weapon Training
Heavy Weapon Training.description: You have a basic education in the use of martial weaponry. You are no longer treated as Untrained with weapons in the Heavy, or Balanced categories.

Heavy Weapon Proficiency.name: Heavy Weapon Proficiency
Heavy Weapon Proficiency.description: You have a fluent education in the use of martial weaponry. You gain the Journeyman training rank and a +1 Skill Bonus with weapons in the Simple, Heavy, and Balanced categories.

Thick Skin.name: Thick Skin
Thick Skin.description: Your physical toughness makes you more resistant to harm. You gain +2 Resistance to Bludgeoning, Slashing, and Piercing damage.

Armored Efficiency.name: Armored Efficiency
Armored Efficiency.description: You are trained in wearing the heaviest types of armor while still retaining mobility. You are able to use a free Movement action once per Turn while wearing Heavy armor.

Penetrating Throw.name: Penetrating Throw
Penetrating Throw.description: You can hurl your weapon with such ferocity that it strikes all targets in a direct line.

penetratingThrow.name: Penetrating Throw
penetratingThrow.description: You perform a Throw weapon strike which penetrates to hit all enemies in a straight line.

description.public: Thin, tapered, and made for piercing, the stiletto is a killer’s weapon — designed to slide between ribs or gaps in armor and leave barely a trace.

Playtest One: The Ring of Valor.name: Playtest One: The Ring of Valor

Introduction.name: Introduction
Introduction.text:
Playtest One: The Ring of Valor is a guided introduction to character development and combat mechanics in Crucible which places players in the role of a gladiatorial team facing a sequence of challenges in the Ring of Valor.

Players may either create their own characters from scratch following the @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.gszlBVQ5fGh3y0I6]{Character Creation} process (recommended) or use the Level 1 premade characters provided in the Pregenerated Heroes compendium pack.

This challenge is designed and balanced for a party of four player characters, although we encourage you to test with a smaller or larger party as well. The difficulty of challenges can be adjusted by manipulating the threat level of @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.v1dqTT3NI35lFNxM]{Adversaries}.

The Ring of Valor consists of six battles, one each day, during which the party faces increasingly dangerous opponents culminating in a final match against the reigning champions - the last group of heroes to overcome the arena. After each encounter, the party advances in level before facing their next test. Each battle is designed to introduce new gameplay mechanics and provide an opportunity to test out new abilities gained through level advancement.

Providing Feedback

If you test Crucible and experience the Ring of Valor, please help us by taking a few moments to @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.5SgXrAKS2EnqVggJ.JournalEntryPage.4Ggutuh9uzhcEXSK]{Provide Feedback} in the #crucible channel of our community Discord server.

Regarding Defeat

Normally, in Crucible - defeat whether by Insanity or Death would be the end of a character's journey. In the case of this initial playtest, however, we recommend that you as the Gamemaster adopt a more flexible approach.

In the interest of testing the system and collecting useful feedback, we recommend allowing a party who experiences defeat to re-attempt the same challenge until successful OR to be permitted to advance to the next challenge regardless should one of the daily challenges prove too difficult to be surmounted.

Day One - The Feral Scramble.name: Day One - The Feral Scramble
Day One - The Feral Scramble.text:
In the Day One challenge, 4 Level 1 heroes face off against a pack of frenzied beasts:

  • 4x @UUID[Actor.tqLT327VnrBXrLtj]{Huiana} (Level ½ Minion)

  • 4x @UUID[Actor.owg68yqumk7KxV9B]{Baizaz} (Level ½ Minion)

Protagonist Threat: 1 × 4 = 4

Adversary Threat: ⅓ × 8 = 2.66

Encounter Difficulty: Difficult

Introduction

The party emerges onto the sand to find themselves in a large arena, surrounded by stands containing a cheering crowd. A commentator spectates from a booth overlooking the sands, where the arena's owner sits. The Commentator's voice is amplified by magic, carried throughout the arena.

We're here on the first day of the Grand Exhibition at the Ring of Valor, and the crowd is already going wild! The first match of the day is about to begin, and as the newcomers step onto the sand for the first time, the crowd is clearly eager to see how they perform. The Scramble is always an audience favorite- will the newcomers survive and triumph against these ravenous wild beasts?!

The party is instructed to proceed to stand in the center of the arena. The Huiana and Baizas are positioned on either side of the arena in groups of 4. Once the party reaches the center of the arena, a few moments are given to build tension and then the beasts emerge from the tunnels on the East and West sides of the map. Add everyone to a Combat encounter and start the combat to roll Initiative for Round 1.

Tactics

The Huiana are pack hunters and rely on flanking tactics to surround and harry a single protagonist, benefitting from their Pack Hunter talent. This challenge serves as an introduction to @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.QhZgmBrdLAGwYy5c.JournalEntryPage.KGXiKFUWrPgb7wsx]{Movement and Flanking} mechanics.

The Baisaz have formidable momentum and power in their charge. The Baisaz will charge a target using their Tusk Charge while using their movement or any remaining action to regain separation from their target to charge again.

Both Huiana and Baisaz are weak against damage to their @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.gszlBVQ5fGh3y0I6.JournalEntryPage.FmmADsI9qo1uIIT3]{Morale}. When the beasts become broken they will flee the arena, retreating down the nearest tunnel into the catacombs below. This initial challenge can serve as a learning experince that demoralizing your foes is a useful path towards victory.

Advancement

The fight ends when all eight beasts have been defeated. The crowd is pleased with the party's performance, and the Commentator announces that the party will be returning tomorrow for another match.

When ready to proceed, characters should each use the Recover action to regain lost resources and all characters should gain a level, advancing to level 2 to face @UUID[.eQdArtcrGi4wobap]{Day Two - Hammer and Anvil}.

Day Two - Hammer and Anvil.name: Day Two - Hammer and Anvil
Day Two - Hammer and Anvil.text:
In the Day Two challenge, 4 Level 2 heroes face off against the gladiatorial duo of Hammer and Anvil (Challenge 9).

  • @UUID[Actor.XA9W38PGmAs3ZLDa]{Hammer} (Level 3 Elite)

  • @UUID[Actor.KSoJR8uwT5Qzka7p]{Anvil} (Level 3 Elite)

Protagonist Threat: 2 × 4 = 8

Adversary Threat: 4 × 2 = 8

Encounter Difficulty: Deadly

Introduction

"It's a beautiful day in the Ring of Valor, and it's looking like we're in for a treat. Today's match marks the return of that deadly duo, the giants of the game, the terrible two: Hammer and Anvil."

The announcer pauses as the crowd roars before continuing: "What a welcome! You can just hear how eager the fans are to see these two in action again. Let's see if our new contenders can stand up to the challenge!"

The party is instructed to gather in front of the tunnel on the west side of the arena. Once the party is in position, Hammer and Anvil emerge from the tunnel on the opposite east side and the battle begins!

Tactics

Hammer and Anvil are a pair of adversaries which fight as a coordinated team.

Anvil's tactics primarily focus on trying to get close and grapple an enemy in order to create opportunities for Hammer to attack. Anvil will use Hammer Toss to get Hammer quickly into the fray and then use Wrestler to restrain enemies and Heavy Strike to deliver punishing blows.

Hammer is a skirmisher, moving in and out of combat to capture opportunities to unleash a devastating sequence of dual-wield attacks using Flurry or using a Strike + Offhand Strike combo. Any enemies that attempt to disengage, Hammer will subdue using Hamstring.

Advancement

The fight ends when both Hammer and Anvil have been defeated. The crowd is pleased with the party's performance, and the Commentator announces that the party will be returning tomorrow for another match.

The party is given a chance to rest, use the Recover action, and gain a level advancing to Level 3 to face @UUID[.v5EIDeTtHdQ7Wb5J]{Day Three - The Skeletal Army}.

Day Three - The Skeletal Army.name: Day Three - The Skeletal Army
Day Three - The Skeletal Army.text:
In the third challenge, 4 Level 3 heroes face off against the necromancer Orivech and his skeleton army!

  • @UUID[Actor.JuobjWohGACVeoyn]{Orivech} (Level 3 Boss)

    • Summoned @UUID[Compendium.crucible.summons.Actor.56puGK932Qc0cowe]{Creation of Death} (Level 1 Minion)

  • 6x @UUID[Actor.aQkmEcwfImmdUINF]{Skeletal Spearman} (Level 1 Minion)

  • 6x @UUID[Actor.7jL3UmgXbqxXKClM]{Skeletal Archer} (Level 1 Minion)

Protagonist Threat: 3 × 4 = 12

Adversary Threat: 6 + (½ × 6) + (½ × 6) = 12

Encounter Difficulty: Deadly

Introduction

For this challenge the party is instructed to assemble with their backs to the cliff on the North side of the arena.

"Welcome back - one and all - to the Ring of Valor for day three of our gripping gauntlet! Today we celebrate the reenactment of one of the historic battles of our history. These few brave champions, their backs to the edge of oblivion, facing down against the dread necromancer Orivech and his skeletal army!"

The crowd roars in eager anticipation as Orivech and his skeletal minions emerge from the south stairs and enter the arena.

Orivech and the skeletons emerge from the south entrance and array themselves in a battle formation before the encounter begins!

Tactics

Orivech will play defensively and rely upon his legion of skeletons to subdue his enemies. As a Boss enemy, Orivech has 10 Action per round and will use the Compose inflection on most spells in order to conserve Focus and will spend leftover Action on Recover Focus.

Orivech' tactics revolve around using the Create gesture to conjure more @UUID[Compendium.crucible.summons.Actor.56puGK932Qc0cowe]{Creation of Death} minions. Orivech can sustain up to 3 such minions at a time because of the Conjurer talent. When threatened directly he will use the Push inflection to force enemies backwards.

The Skeletal Archers will Strike to focus fire at whichever target Orivech designates, using Evasive Shot to reposition themselves. The Skeletal Spearman will rush forward to engage enemy fighters and block their path, trying to trip them with Leg Sweep.

Advancement

The fight ends when Orivech is defeated. When the necromancer falls, his skeletal minions disintegrate to dust alongside him. The crowd is pleased with the party's performance, and the Commentator announces that the party will be returning tomorrow for another match.

The party is given a chance to rest, use the Recover action, and gain a level advancing to Level 4. All heroes may also increase the quality of their equipped Weapons to Fine. After resting, the gauntlet continues with @UUID[.hEpGF7rbNFVUMm86]{Day Four - Koy Rent}.

Day Four - Koy Rent.name: Day Four - Koy Rent
Day Four - Koy Rent.text:
In this fourth challenge, 4 level 4 heroes square off against the lycanthropic menace Koy Rent.

  • @UUID[Actor.3sGYsiKtgYLLkadw]{Koy Rent} (Level 7 Boss)

Protagonist Threat: 4 × 4 = 16

Adversary Threat: 14

Encounter Difficulty: Difficult

Introduction

For this challenge, the party assembles on the east side of the Arena.

"Today's match is a special one- featuring the return of a retired champion in a one-day-only exhibition! Folks, you know him, you love him, he's here, he's there, he is EV-ERY-WHERE!--- Koy Rent! Rent left the ring after a grievous injury, cheered off the field of victory by an understanding crowd. With him back in the games we have to wonder: will he climb to champion or will he fall to these new contenders?"

Koy Rent enters the arena from the West entrance and immediately attacks!

Tactics

Koy Rent is a formidable fighter. As a Level 7 Boss with significant Health and Morale pools, the party will have little hope of withstanding his onslaught in direct melee combat.

Rent will use Ferocious Howl to inflict the Frightened condition and move quickly to close distance into melee range with as many enemies as possible. Rent will use Flurry when facing a single target to subdue them quickly with a relentless onslaught of claw attacks, dealing additional bleeding damage through the Bloodletter talent.

The party cannot hope to withstand this onslaught in melee combat and will need to think carefully about how to slow Koy Rent down.

Advancement

The fight ends when Koy Rent is defeated. The crowd is pleased with the party's performance, and the Commentator announces that the party will be returning tomorrow for another match.

The party is given a chance to rest, use the Recover action, and gain a level; advancing to Level 5. All heroes may also increase the quality of their equipped Armor to Fine. The party returns the next day to face @UUID[.sISxZXCLNvpjkY02]{Day Five - Void Harbingers}.

Day Five - Void Harbingers.name: Day Five - Void Harbingers
Day Five - Void Harbingers.text:
In this challenge, 4 Level 5 heroes face off against a trio of Void Harbingers:

  • @UUID[Actor.YVvIKp7fUIduZchE]{Harbinger of Fear} (L4 Elite)

  • @UUID[Actor.TZT7ybsmI8yV5hWg]{Harbinger of Disease} (L4 Elite)

  • @UUID[Actor.CTpEm0WlmFAAosBD]{Harbinger of Madness} (L4 Elite)

Protagonist Threat: 4 × 5 = 20

Adversary Threat: 3 × 6 = 18

Encounter Difficulty: Deadly

Introduction

"Tonight we're in for some true excitement as the summoners have conjured a new challenge from realms beyond the umbral veil! Ladies and gentlemen, from the darkest recesses and liminal spaces beyond the edge of reality, welcome to the Ring of Valor: the Void Harbingers!"

Tactics

The Harbinger of Fear is a mobile predator that feasts on fearful thoughts. It will use Ethereal Warp to move freely about the battlefield and Eldritch Emanataion to inflict fear on groups of enemies. Once it has isolated a frightened enemy it will Strike with it's Psychic Maw.

The Harbinger of Disease is a bearer of pestilence that inflicts the Diseased condition using it's Pestilent Lash ability. This Harbinger also has spellcasting ability which it will use to further sap life and morale, targeting groups of enemies with the Pulse gesture or individual targets using Influence.

The Harbinger of Madness is a psychological predator which will close to melee range before using the Mind Flay ability against groups of enemies or Devour Thoughts against a single foe.

Advancement

The fight ends when all three Harbingers are defeated. The crowd is pleased with the party's performance, and the Commentator announces that the party will be returning tomorrow for another match.

The party is given a chance to rest, use the Recover action, and gain a level; advancing to Level 6. All heroes may also increase the quality of their equipped Armor to Fine. The party returns the next day to face @UUID[.UxIXSvvJCdqx2Tar]{Day Six - Mirror Match}.

Day Six - Mirror Match.name: Day Six - Mirror Match
Day Six - Mirror Match.text:
In this final challenge, 4 Level 6 heroes come head-to-head with a rival adventuring party comprised of 4 Level 6 heroes.

  • @UUID[Actor.iLUfMcYjAbZFY4CJ]{Duurath} (Level 6)

  • @UUID[Actor.0crVYYsPvV9KDEJ2]{Belladonna} (Level 6)

  • @UUID[Actor.2lvTCCOj4dnBI774]{Eliorwen} (Level 6)

  • @UUID[Actor.Il4NDaNBdHNcjJ9d]{Kagura} (Level 6)

Protagonist Threat: 4 × 6 = 24

Adversary Threat: 4 × 6 = 24

Encounter Difficulty: Deadly

Introduction

"Tonight we're in for some true excitement as the summoners have conjured a new challenge from realms beyond the umbral veil! Ladies and gentlemen, from the darkest recesses and liminal spaces beyond the edge of reality, welcome to the Ring of Valor: the Void Harbingers!"

This is an especially difficult challenge because all four opposing heroes are individually optimized and work well as a team.

Tactics

Each of the opponents in this challenge functions as a heroic protagonist with their own array of talents, actions, and equipment.

Duurath

Duurath is a dangerous melee combatant with high Engagement, strong physical defense, and the Dread Lord signature talent which demoralizes and frightens foes. Duurath will close on enemy combatants using Shield Charge and lock them down using Cadence to deliver high damage or Counter Strike to retaliate when blocking incoming blows. Defensively, Duurath can use Kinetic Ward to protect himself from a chosen type of physical damage.

Belladonna

Belladonna is a cunning and elusive melee combatant with the Poisoner talent. At the beginning of the battle she will activate Poison Blades. She will use Distract against enemy spellcasters to sap their Focus, and Combat Medicine to restore the health of her allies. Belladonna will seek out more vulnerable enemy combatants, closing to melee range using Tumble if necessary and Flurry to apply rapid damage and poisoned conditions.

Eliorwen

Eliorwen is a deadly archer, infusing shots from her Longbow with lightning spells using her Arcane Archer talent. Eliorwen will identify a dangerous enemy and target them with Mark Prey to reduce their defenses for herself and her allies. She will use Precision Shot coupled with reduced cost Voltaic Arrow to deliver reliable sustained damage from a distance.

Kagura

Kagura is a versatile support character able to heal both mind and body of her allies. She will cast the Life rune using either the Influence, Pulse, or Ray gestures to trigger additional healing from her Mender talent. Kagura can sustain healing nearly indefinitely through thoughtful use of the Compose inflection as well as Conserve Effort. Kagura avoids direct confrontation and instead will disengage from combat and seek protection from her allies.

Advancement

The fight ends when all four adversaries are defeated. The crowd is thrilled with the party's performance and celebrates them as eternal champions of the Ring of Valor. There are not any more planned events in the Ring of Valor at this time, but please see @UUID[.aNlzMnfUkwpLrSox]{Further Challenges} if you wish to continue testing by improvising new challenges for the party to face.

Further Challenges.text:
Thank you for completing the Crucible Playtest. We hope that you and your players enjoyed the testing experience. For further challenges to evaluate the system, we recommend the following:

  1. Repeat the @UUID[.UxIXSvvJCdqx2Tar]{Day Six - Mirror Match} challenge but with different combinations of Level 6 Pregen characters as adversaries.

  2. Create your own @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.v1dqTT3NI35lFNxM]{Adversaries} by testing out the initial system of Taxonomies and Archetypes.

Please consider taking the time to @UUID[Compendium.crucible.rules.JournalEntry.5SgXrAKS2EnqVggJ.JournalEntryPage.4Ggutuh9uzhcEXSK]{Provide Feedback} which can help us further develop and improve this new role-playing game system.
